resources.string: A simple app to view images from NASA\'s APOD service
APOD Viewer is an open-source app that allows you to view APODs from NASA, as well as share, save and download them, or set them as wallpaper.

Astronomy Picture Of the Day (APOD) is originated, written, coordinated and edited since 1995 by Robert Nemiroff and Jerry Bonnell. The APOD archive contains the largest collection of annotated astronomical images on the internet.
Thanks to these libraries for making my work easy!
There seems to be no network connection. Try connecting to the Internet and retrying.
Tap the bookmark button to bookmark an APOD
You haven\'t discovered any APODs yet. Tap the button below to begin!
HD version of this not available!
This cannot be set as wallpaper or other image!
Use a custom APOD API key from \nhttps://api.nasa.gov/
Allow APOD Viewer to automatically check for new APODs and update the local database in the background
Allow APOD Viewer to notify you of new APODs
Allow APOD Viewer to automatically set new APODs as device wallpaper
Do you want to set today\'s APOD as wallpaper now?
Default quality while setting image as wallpaper or other photo
Format for filenames while saving APODs
Format for text while sharing APODs
Clear local database of APOD data (does not clear cached images)
Clear locally cached images (does not clear local database of APODs)
Without granting access to storage, images cannot be saved to your device.
In order to save the image to your device, permission to access storage is required. Please grant it in order to save the image. You won\'t have to grant this again.
The High Quality image for some APODs may be significantly different from the Normal Quality one. You can view the High Quality image in-app by using the [HD] button.
Text size must be between 5 and 40
This app is not endorsed by NASA.

All APODs are credited to the owner or institution where they originated. Some of the images are copyrighted and to use these pictures publicly or commercially one must write to the owners for permission. For more information, go here.

The image of Saturn used here (beside the APOD description at the top of this page) is from NASA and can be found here.


All icons used in this app, excluding the app icon (Saturn icon), and the GitHub and Telegram icons, are from Google\'s Material Design Icons, used under the Apache License v2.0.

The GitHub icon has been used from GitHub, and the same can be found here.

The Telegram icon has been used from Telegram, and the same can be found
Special thanks to the following for making my work easy!

Firstly, thanks to everyone and everything that helped me learn Android development.

GIMP for making it easy to create a great app icon, and also to tweak other icons.

Android Studio for making Android app development easy.

The Java and Android Documentation.

All those wonderful Q/A threads on Stack Overflow that helped me solve problems I faced.

All those blogs as well as YouTube videos that showed me how to do various stuff in this app.

Thanks to everyone who helped test this app.

And last, but not the least, thanks to you for using this app!
Layout is unlocked, tap to lock
Layout is locked, tap to unlock
